Space Delivery
Game Design Document

by Jimmy Lin, Runkai Qiu, Stephen Tang

INTRODUCTION

This document describes a game called “Space Delivery”, which is designed to be a simple, 2D side-scrolling shooter game. The game will employ sprite-based animation, an imaged background, physics, AI, auto-scrolling, and more 2D game techniques.


TECHNOLOGY

Space Delivery will be developed for the Windows Platform using McKilla's Gorilla game engine, a bare-bones engine Richard McKenna developed for rapid prototyping 2D games.


BACKSTORY

You play as an employee of the “Galaxy Delivery Service” (GDS for short). One day on your delivery route, aliens, or what you think they are, attack you. You, being too underpaid to care, decide to just finish the run and go home.


OBJECTIVE

Your task is to pilot your ship and defend yourself from the oncoming aliens attacking your ship to make sure that your product doesn't get damaged or stolen. You are armed with an average delivery ship with minimal weapons, however, you can upgrade your ship to have better weapons.


GAMEPLAY

The game would work as an auto scroller scrolling upwards. You are able to move around the screen while shooting at enemies, you have a booster and a temporary shield that you can deploy.

You would have to be careful as enemies can also shoot at you and attack you in different formations. When they get impaient, they will even come and ram you

When an enemy is defeated, they have a chance of dropping scrap, the material that you use to repair and upgrade your ship.

WIP


CONTROLS

This game will be played using only a keyboard

  • W - Move Up
  • A - Move Left
  • S - Move Down
  • D - Move Right
  • SPACE - Shoot
  • E - Activates Shield
  • R - Activates Booster
  • ESC - Pauses the Game

SOUND EFFECTS

All sound effects will be original. Sounds must be made to coincide with each of the following events:

  • Shielding
  • Boosting
  • Shooting
  • Enemy Shooting
  • Bullet Hit Enemy
  • Bullet Hit Player
  • Dying
